messages.message: I'm getting this error with the latest master, this happens whenever I open any *app*, any help will be appreciated

this works fine for me on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) and dogfood (which should have code within last 6 hours).

maybe clean webapp and restart it?

Are you running server-nginx?
1. Run `make build-docker run-docker-proxy`
2. Restart webapp.
3. Go to localhost (not localhost:5000)
@Heymian on localhost i think we use `proxy_for_localonly`?
We changed how it should be run in the last week or so. It’s mentioned in a couple of slack conversations and easily got buried.
what URL are you trying to hit?

http://localhost:5000/apps/diff-checker/shivamparashar/first-repo

Just using localhost, isn't leading anywhere, can you explain a bit?
Can you copy-paste me the output of your server-nginx?
there’s a link in there that should look like `chrome:…settings`.

172.17.0.1 - - [06/Feb/2020:08:33:36 +0000] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 301 443 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/79.0.3945.130 Safari/537.36"
172.17.0.1 - - [06/Feb/2020:08:35:30 +0000] "GET /apps/classifier/shivamparashar/first-repo HTTP/1.1" 301 484 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/79.0.3945.130 Safari/537.36"

Issue solved. (heymian explained)
1. I had to restart Ngix.
2. Go here in chrome: `<chrome://flags/#allow-insecure-localhost>`
3. and enable that first thing. Allow invalid certificates for resources loaded from localhost
4. now try to go to `https://localhost`
It's because now we're using nginx to route different services. And we no longer need special port 5000.
